description: From an alteration of rascallion, a fanciful elaboration of rascal (“someone who is naughty”).

adjectives.description: rapscallion (comparative more rapscallion, superlative most rapscallion)

examples: "I baint a-going to give my master's property to a lot of rapscallion thieves and robbers like you."

entries.meaning: (archaic) A rascal, scamp, rogue, or scoundrel.
examples: She was the sister who had remained within the pale; I, the rapscallion of a brother whose vagaries were trying to his relations.
